issue.title: [CF 132] Error while configuring
issue.body:
ATTACHING A SAVED VARIABLES FILE/SCREENSHOT WILL GET YOUR TICKET ANSWERED MUCH FASTER

Saved variables can be found in: "World of Warcraft/WTF/Account/<Account Name>/SavedVariables/TellMeWhen. lua"

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Open options
2.
3.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
I got an error when I opened the options, but it hasn't happened always

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
TellMeWhen 4 Beta 3

Do you have an error log of what happened?
Message: ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:736: attempt to index global 'self' (a nil value)
Time: 03/03/11 11:38:11
Count: 1
Stack: ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:736: in function <...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:734>

Locals: uiScale = 0.63999998569489
(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = nil

(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = nil
(*temporary) = "attempt to index global 'self' (a nil value)"
max = <function> defined =[C]:-1

Please provide any additional information below.
Guess I'll also point out at this moment since the error metions something about the UI scale that I think the config window seems rather large, I'm playing with a 1600x1200 resolution and the window takes nearly a quarter of my screen.


> Posted by CurseForge user Beruchan | Imported from CurseForge issue #132 | Raw

comments.body:
Attachment Added: WoWScrnShot_030311_113930.jpg

WoWScrnShot_030311_113930.jpg

<p>Screenshot of config with error</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user Beruchan

Thanks for the error report. Regarding the window size, it can be scaled in the main options for TMW. I should probably let people click and drag the corner to resize it too.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
